page.description: The A5.SAVE_USER_COLORS() method saves the custom color settings that are defined in the dot variable Color. Custom color setting are stored in the current database's .ADB file. Custom colors are defined using the View > Settings command. Currently, Alpha Anywhere only supports one color scheme named "Default".

argument.name: name
argument.description: The name of the color scheme. Currently, Alpha Anywhere only supports one color scheme named "Default".

argument.name: color_info
argument.description: The dot variable that contains the user's custom color definitions.

section.title: Example
section.description: The following script gets the custom color settings and stores them in a dot variable called colors. The script then goes on to change the definition of color1.
section.example: 'Initialize Colors variable dim colors.color[32] as P for i = 1 to 32 colors.color[i].NAME = "" colors.color[i].handle = 0 colors.color[i].color.red = 0 colors.color[i].color.green = 0 colors.color[i].color.blue = 0 next :a5.LOAD_USER_colors("Default",colors) 'Change color 1 definition. colors.color[1].NAME = "new red" colors.color[1].color.red = 200 colors.color[1].color.green = 20 colors.color[1].color.blue = 20 'Save edited colors :a5.save_user_colors("Default",colors)
